occupation: Data Visualization Designer & Speaker at Depict Data Studio
headline: Founder & Principal, Eval4Learning
summary:
Ann K. Emery is an internationally-acclaimed speaker who equips organizations to get their data out of dusty spreadsheets and into real-world conversations. 

Each year, she delivers over 100 keynotes, workshops, and webinars with the aim of equipping organizations to visualize data more effectively. 

She has been invited to speak in 30 states and 10 countries; 6,000 people have enrolled in her online training academy; and she has consulted to 200 organizations, including the United Nations, Centers for Disease Control, and Harvard University. 

She earned a Bachelor’s degree from the University of Virginia and a Master’s degree from George Mason University. 

After traveling full-time as a digital nomad, Ann now resides in Florida along with her husband and three children.

experiences.title: Data Visualization Designer & Speaker
experiences.description: Depict Data Studio provides data visualization training through online courses, in-person workshops, and conference keynotes. We also transform your spreadsheets into data stories through our custom design projects.

accomplishment_publications.name: Coalition Assessment: Approaches for Measuring Capacity and Impact
accomplishment_publications.description: Why assess coalition capacity? How should a coalition be assessed? How can coalition assessment data be analyzed and used? This new publication provides practitioners and funders with insights into the coalition assessment process along with concrete examples and lessons we’ve learned from our own work.

recommendations:
Juan Martin Romualdez



I cannot overstate the value that Ann brought to our working group, as we were launching a pilot program which provided employment and career development services to individuals who were struggling to regain or maintain their stability in almost all areas of their lives.  Ann was very sensitive to the needs and challenges of our target population, but was absolutely committed to providing us with the most accurate data and overall "picture" of our program's strengths and weaknesses, as well as its most meaningful outcome measures.  She also demonstrated a unique ability to help everyone in the team recognize and realize that despite differences in perspectives and priorities, we were all striving toward the same goal.  I would encourage anyone who wanted a true evaluation of his or her program, to connect with Ann and discover how much she can help you understand what you are trying to do and what you are actually accomplishing.
